content: विलुप् {c6c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To break off, pull out, cut off. {@--2@} To seize, plunder, rob, carry off. {@--3@} To mar, spoil, impair. {@--4@} ({%a%}) To destroy, ruin, cause to disappear; प्रियमत्यंतविलुप्तदर्शनं <ls>Ku. 4. 2</ls> ‘for ever lost to view’. ({%b%}) To eat up; क्रव्याद्भिरंगलतिका नियतं विलुप्ता <ls>U. 3. 28</ls>, <ls>Mk. 1. 9.</ls> {@--5@} To wipe or rub off. {%--<ab>Pass.</ab>%} To be destroyed or lost, to perish, disappear; जराविलुप्तमानावमानचिंतः <ls>Dk.</ls>
